legal.scope_text: Neighbors Kitchen is a mediation platform for sharing food within a community. Neighbors Kitchen does not mediate purchase contracts for food in a commercial sense. It is a community for preventing food waste. Contracts for sharing food are exclusively concluded between the offering user (chef) and the receiving user (guest).
legal.payment_text: The use of the platform is basically free of charge. Payments are considered voluntary cost contributions (for ingredients/energy) or donations to the chef. For transactions via the platform, a service fee of CHF 2.00 is charged. This fee is used to operate the platform and is directly withheld during booking.
legal.liability_text: The chefs are solely responsible for the quality, hygiene, and declaration of ingredients (allergens) of their food. Neighbors Kitchen assumes no liability for health damages arising from the consumption of the mediated food.
legal.cancellation_text: Bookings are binding. Cancellations are only possible until the time set by the chef. In case of no-show, there is no entitlement to a refund of the service fee.
legal.privacy_text: We treat your data confidentially and do not share it with third parties, except when necessary for processing the booking (e.g., sharing the address with the guest after booking). We use Stripe for payments; their privacy policies apply.

faq.title: Help & FAQ
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Neighbors Kitchen
faq.install_guide: How to use Neighbors Kitchen correctly
faq.ios_instructions: Tap "Share" (square with arrow) at the bottom and select "Add to Home Screen".
faq.android_instructions: Tap the menu (3 dots) at the top and select "Install app".
faq.notification_description: Allow us to notify you when your neighbor is cooking!
faq.notification_unsupported: Your browser does not support notifications.
faq.notification_body: You will now receive notifications about new meals in your area.
faq.a1: Registration is free. You only pay if the chef has selected the "Online Payment (Apple Pay / Card)" option. Payment is then made digitally during reservation.
faq.a2: No! Here, private neighbors cook for neighbors. It's about community and preventing food waste, not commercial sales.
faq.q3: Do I have to meet the chef?
faq.a3: Yes, the handover usually takes place in person. With "Ghost Mode", anonymous pickup is also possible, for example at the house entrance, mailbox, or at a nearby tram stop.
faq.a4: Women can set their offers to be visible only to other women. This increases safety and creates a protected space for female users.
faq.q5: What happens if I don't show up?
faq.a5: That's unfair! Anyone who doesn't show up receives a bad rating. This can lead to immediate Karma deductions and, in the worst case, suspension. You can cancel bookings for free within 15 minutes.
faq.a6: Yes! Many chefs accept barter (e.g., dessert for main course or a bottle of wine). After the meal, you can choose whether to send money or bring something.
faq.a7: We rely on trust & community reviews. Pay attention to Karma points and positive reviews from other users.
faq.q8: How do I become a chef?
faq.a8: Anyone can immediately offer meals once the profile photo is uploaded (mandatory). If you additionally want to receive the ‚úì Verified badge, click "Get Verified" in the profile (optional ID upload).
faq.a9: Using the app is free. For digital transactions, a fixed service fee of CHF 2.00 is charged to operate and further develop the platform.
faq.q10: Where can I see the exact location?
faq.a10: To protect privacy, you only see the exact address after booking confirmation by the chef. Before that, only the approximate neighborhood is displayed.
faq.more_questions: More questions? Contact us via the feedback form in the profile.
